Mr. Flores is trying to convince his students that there are more effective ways to study. He has his students use two different strategies to remember a list of 20 random words over two consecutive weeks. During week one, the students repeat the words 5 times, and during week two, they create an analogy for each word based on its definition. The results of the study were posted on his classroom door as proof of how students should study.
content.question: Based on the information presented in the scenario, which of the following ethical procedures did Mr. Flores violate?

choices.label: Mr. Flores did not use random assignment with the groups.
Mr. Flores should avoid using his own students in research.
Mr. Flores should have kept the students’ results anonymous.
Mr. Flores may have caused psychological harm to the students.

content.answer: Mr. Flores should have kept the students’ results anonymous.

skill.text: 2.D: Evaluate whether a psychological research scenario followed appropriate ethical procedures.
